question.title: Observability with java spring boot actuator and micrometer annotation @Counted is ignored while @Timed works fine
question.body:
Following documents and examples I try to implement @Counted and @Timed annotation based observability, basing on spring boot actuator, micrometer. There are no build or run errors. a method in the code which is invoked has got the following 2 annotations:

@Counted(value="invalidate.cache.invocations",description="count cache invalidations")
@Timed(value="invalidate.cache.duration",description="time taken to invalidate the cache")

Running the app:

http://<server>:<port>/actuator/metrics

reflects only the @Timed one, but not the @Counted one, meaning that I can see among the metrics: invalidate.cache.duration, but I'm unable to see invalidate.cache.invocations. Similarly:

http://<server>:<port>/actuator/metrics/invalidate.cache.invocations

is n/a as 404.

    http://<server>:<port>/actuator/metrics/invalidate.cache.duration

is valid and reflects the metric content.

I'm not sure whether related or not, the following URL also gives 404:

 http://<server>:<port>/actuator/actuator/promethues

How comes? Why there is a difference between these 2 annotations?
